title: Jordan Henderson and Daniel Sturridge remain major doubts for Liverpool's next game against Burnley
text:
Sport Jordan Henderson and Daniel Sturridge remain major doubts for Liverpool's next game against Burnley The influential duo have been forced to miss the last two games and were unable to join their team-mates for full training on Wednesday Share Henderson looks set to miss the Burnley game on Sunday (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty Images) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Liverpool captain Jordan Henderson and Daniel Sturridge are both doubts for Sunday's visit of Burnley. 
The pair have both missed the last two matches, Henderson with a foot problem while Sturridge had a virus and then suffered a hip injury. 
Reports suggest that neither have returned to full training yet and were not able to rejoin their team-mates on Wednesday. Henderson has been missed at the heart of the Liverpool midfield (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty) Daniel Sturridge has suffered a frustrating spell on the sidelines through injury (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
Off the field, the club have taken their plans for a Â£50million redevelopment of their academy to incorporate a new first-team training facility to local residents. 
A one-day consultation was held in Kirkby where members of the public were able to view the proposals and speak to representatives from the club and Knowsley Metropolitan Borough Council, as well as planning and construction experts. Plans are in place for a new training base (Photo: Getty) 
Plans include the construction of a new combined training centre, the redevelopment of the existing facilities including an upgraded pitch, a new stand for spectators and designs to convert the main pitch into a first-class covered full-sized pitch. 
Liverpool need to purchase land next to the current academy site for the expansion and, as a result, new and improved pitches and changing facilities for local amateur teams as well as dog-walking and cycle paths will be created. poll loading Is Jordan Henderson the Premier League's hardest-working player? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
